posts.author: PaladinPete
posts.content:
I've been thinking about campaigns lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about campaigns that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with campaigns and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about campaigns?

posts.author: CriticalElf
posts.content:
I've been playing a Half-Orc Wizard in my campaign, and I've noticed that campaigns really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

In our last session, we encountered a Tarrasque and tried to use campaigns to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around campaigns? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

In my campaign, we had a situation with campaigns that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: BardTales
posts.content:
When DMing, I like to use advice as a way to create interesting challenges for my players.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use advice to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for advice are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about advice. Based on my experience, it works differently.

posts.author: CriticalElf
posts.content:
I've been playing a Dragonborn Paladin in my campaign, and I've noticed that advice really impacts how effective the character is in combat.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that advice functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

My DM interprets advice differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?
